Material used.Material Name: U-87MG and LN229 glioblastoma cell lines, human astrocytes
Material used.Description: Glioblastoma cell lines U-87MG and LN229 were used along with human astrocytes derived from patients with Parkinson's disease.

Readout description.Result Description: Protein expression levels were significantly reduced in cells expressing the c.100A>G variant compared to wild-type controls.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each condition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate to ensure consistency.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PARK2 cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for comparisons between groups, and ANOVA for multiple group comparisons.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression levels greater than 80% of wild-type controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression levels less than 50% of wild-type controls.
